intro: Solanum bumeliifolium, commonly known as the Bumelia leaf nightshade, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes potatoes, tomatoes, and tobacco. The plant features heart-shaped, hairy leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the spring. Its fruits are berries that turn red when mature, containing several seeds. Botanically, it is characterized by its glandular hairs and its ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments.
